pageContext.claim: “I will say this: When Kanye came out very strongly a number of months ago, something happened. My polls went up, like, 25 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a bad read of a flawed poll, which did not link Trump's approval among blacks to Kanye West, anyway. Reputable polls consistently find that Trump has very low support among African Americans -- and that it has declined since the 2016 election. For example, Quinnipiac in August found that 9 percent of black voters approved, compared with 85 percent who disapproved. Trump seemingly was referring to a single, poorly rated poll that is often an outlier giving him higher numbers (Rasmussen).
